response.question:
Q) i/p player = 6neurons
o/p layer = 2neurons
response.student_answer:
weight b/w i/p & hidden layer
Rows = no. of neurons - neuron in i/p
= 5x6
=[2x5]; [5x6]_z
response.correct_answer: The question is incomplete as it does not specify the number of hidden layers or neurons. Assuming a single hidden layer with 'h' neurons, the weight matrix between the input and hidden layer would have dimensions (h x 6), and the weight matrix between the hidden and output layer would have dimensions (2 x h).
response.feedback: Assessment: Partially Correct. Your answer correctly identifies the pattern for weight matrix dimensions based on your assumption of a 5-neuron hidden layer, resulting in plausible dimensions of 5x6 and 2x5. However, the question did not specify the size of the hidden layer, so you made an assumption. More importantly, the formula you wrote, 'Rows = no. of neurons - neuron in i/p', is conceptually incorrect. The correct rule is that a weight matrix connecting layer L-1 to layer L has dimensions (number of neurons in L) x (number of neurons in L-1).
